Nuxt 3.7 is out, bringing a new CLI, native web streams and response, rendering optimisations, async context support - and much more.
and this marks the first Nuxt release that depends on the new version, safely in its own repository. We have grand plans for this - check out some of the features + roadmap discussions in
and please feel free to contribute!
The journey of Nuxt CLI Generations
Nuxi is now decoupled from the main
version - we plan to iterate and release nuxi more quickly in future so you can expect new things coming soon!
, it's now possible to directly return a
object from server routes, meaning it's
possible to return and handle streams natively in Nuxt.

This release comes with a couple of improvements in rendering HTML responses from the server. We now determine whether to preload/prefetch resources at build time (so you can customise this in the
hook). We also now manage rendering the HTML for them directly in
), which means you can configure the
, and more. And - in our preliminary testing - it's even faster!
It's possible to opt-in to upcoming head improvements with the
flag. This currently includes a new ordering algorithm based on
) and allows enabling future optimisations as they are released in
language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
We'd love your thoughts - you can respond with any issues/feedback in
In your Nuxt config you can now use
shortcuts to easily define configuration that is specific to just the Vite client/server (
) builds. This previously was only possible with the

We've chosen to unpin Vite from minor versions, meaning whenever Vite releases a new feature version you can opt-in straight away. Vite 4.4 brings a lot of exciting things, including experimental Lightning CSS support - and much more!
We now use purely relative paths in the generated
. This means better support for dev environments like docker images where the absolute path may not match your IDE (
We also set a couple of additional compiler flag defaults to match Vite/TS recommendations (
Plus, you should now get type hinted access to layouts in
If you've ever got an issue with 'Nuxt context unavailable' this might be one for you. We now support  native async context for Bun and Node under an experimental flag, in both Nuxt and Nitro (
This enables using Nuxt composables on the server
needing to ensure they are being called directly in a setup function. It also allows the same in Nitro, with a new
utility that is usable in server routes.
To try it out, you can enable
We've fixed a couple of issues with watchers, meaning that you should need to restart your server less often - and you should see a significant performance increase if you are using layers.
There lots more exciting features coming directly from Nitro 2.6, including smaller, lighter servers and new persistent data storage in a
As usual, our recommendation for upgrading is to run:
language-sh shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
This will refresh your lockfile as well, and ensures that you pull in updates from other dependencies that Nuxt relies on, particularly in the

We are thrilled to release the new nuxt.com, powered by Nuxt UI and now open source.
Learn how we made Nuxt 3 capable of running on edge runtimes to run with server-side rendering close to your users.
